description.narrative: The Punjab State Road Sector Project for India aims at increasing the service levels of the state roads. This restructuring is for an interim extension of the loan closing date for the project for three months from the current loan closing date of June 5, 2012 until September 5, 2012. This interim extension is required to prepare and submit a detailed case for extension of the loan closing date for five year to support a new long-term asset management for the road network. The five extension request would entail a first level project restructuring, The Government of Punjab has recommended a 5 year loan extension, duly endorsed by Department of Economic Affairs. Second phase Output and Performance-based Road Contracts (OPRC) contract, which is a ten year long contract on asset management principles, requires technical support and handholding of the Government for at least the first five years. The Government of Punjab at several occasions indicated their commitment towards this project and the new long-term asset management concept.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Data Collection, Management and Reporting | Description :PRBDB shall carry out a traffic census and vehiclespeed survey every two years; publish the results in an Annual State of the Network Report; it shall carry an annual road conditionsurvey of report. | Due Date :31-Mar-2009
Finance Agreement :Flow of Funds | Description :GOP shall transfer funds to PRBDB within fourteen (14) calendar days of its receiptfrom GOI. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Institutional Strengthening | Description :GOP shall take all necessary measures to ensure that the Frameworkwhich includes Action Plan for Enhancing Transparency and Accountability, is revised and amended without Bank's prior approval. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Management Information Systems | Description :PRBDB shall design and operationalize by January 31, 2008, aManagement Information System acceptable to the Bank for the monitoring of project implementation | Due Date :31-Jan-2008

title.narrative: Maintain total number of fatal accidents at 2005 level of 2,655
Increase in average network speed by 30% (entire network)
Maintain poor and bad network condition @ 4%
Maintain International Roughness Index (IRI) m/km for project roads (Phase 1) on the network
Reduction in Vehicle Operating Costs (VOCs) by 20%
Department wide computerization and use of integrated systems for plannng, management, financial accounting, monitoring

target.value: Final Roll out to the entire department.

actual.value: Modules have been developed and testing is ongoing. The system will go live by end of May 2017

title.narrative: Improvement in efficiency of Road Agency (PWD, PRBDB) (based on RUSS)
Total km of roads improved and rehabilitated under the project w.e.f. YR6 (OPRC)
